NLP is a field of artificial intelligence (AI) related to the interaction between computers and natural human language and its understanding. In this case, we used the TextBlob  package. Textblob is a Python library for processing textual data and has a built-in pipeline for processing the text with a sequence of Natural Language Processing steps. In our case, we first divided the patient note into sentences and then split each sentence back into words. Next, we tagged each word using part-of-speech tagging, which assigned each word a part of speech. For this, we used the part-of-speech tagger , which is a dictionary or vocabulary that identifies individual words and phrases in a sentence and classifies them by part of speech (noun, verb, adjective, etc.) and then added some custom rules such as abbreviation expansion. Then, we used dependency parsing, which parses the words into clauses and sentences. For dependency parsing, we used the SpaCy implementation of the Stanford Parser  and its Python interface. This implementation uses Python’s built-in libraries to compile a finite-state parser. This parser takes the text and its grammatical structure and builds a parse tree. A parse tree is a tree-like structure that shows the sentence’s grammatical structure.</s>

895.output: Assisted reproductive technologies (ARTs) refer to the processes of diagnosis, treatment, and management of patients who have or want to become pregnant, through the use of techniques such as in vitro fertilization (IVF), gamete intrafallopian transfer (GIFT), and artificial insemination by donor semen. In addition, ovulation induction (OI), ovum pickup, and so on are also part of ART (Li et al., 2022). ART has existed for over 100 years, since ovarian stimulation was first recorded in 1901 (Steuer et al., 1993). With the advancement of ART techniques in recent years, the number of births from these techniques has increased dramatically year-by-year. For instance, the first IVF-embryo transfer (ET) resulted in twin pregnancies in 1981, by 2019, over 99,000 IVF-ET cycles were performed annually and resulted in approximately 1% of all live births(Li et al., 2022).</s>
